name: GPPhazerThunderbird_CS
description: This is a mock USAF Thunderbirds color scheme for the Great Planes Phazer

name: HSD T-33 Thunderbird-FoamTexture_CS
description:
Added a spec and updated normals map to give it a painted foam look.

Great model by Donamy. Thanks for the terrific EA

name: Extra360Done_EA
description:
This is a final version of my Extra360. Complete with fully animated servos,and motor.Also prop was changed to a 12x6 as per "Opjose" comment on the original.The CS leaves something to be desired as that is not my strong suit. p.s. This model is 26 poly tri's from the 20000 limit.




Enjoy

name: GR-7 Formula One_EA
description:
A designer by the name of Robbie Grove created the GR-7 in the late 80's. There were only two made #55 "Bummers Bullet",and #96 "Blue Streak". Although not a winner the blue streak was a top qualifier in 1989 clocked at 242 mph. There is a coll mesh for this plane despite the fact the model is well under the 8000 cap for non use of coll mesh. 4598 poly tris





Enjoy

name: Lindberg's Lockheed Sirius_EA
description:
This is the lockheed Sirius owned and flown by Charles A. Lindbergh.
This model has a 96" wing span and measures 60" nose to tail. It's quite nimble as was the RL aircraft. Powered by a Fuji Imvac BT-50SB 46.5cc turning a 18"x12 prop.




Many cameras one in each cockppit and one above the tail.
the cockpit cams move with the flaps knob
Anyone interested in doing a CS for this one PM me and I'll send you a template

Thanks to rcplanefubar and dhk79 for the 9cylinder radial engine generously posted in the parts repository.

History..
Built by the Lockheed company in 1930 the Sirius is the wheeled predecessor to Charles A. Lindbergh's Float plane nicknamed the "Tingmissartog". Which means "One who flies like big bird" in the Inuit language. Originaly named the "Explorer" and built for Harold Bromley in hopes to win th Tokyo Ashi prize of $25,000 for the first trans pacific flight between Japan and America. Although during takeoff over filled fuel tanks spilled into Harolds eyes blinding him and causing a crash. A second attempt at building the Explorer failed. So a third was made but now incorporating changes requested by Lindbergh including the name change to "Sirius". Harold never was succesfull in his attempts some of which didn't include the Lockheed company.




Enjoy

name: Beck-Mahoney Sorceress_EA
description:
The Beck-Mahoney Sorceress. The first biplane to break 200mph in competition and won the most races than any other in her class. The Sorceress was the state of the art in the 70's and 80's and now sits in the Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum.




Turn on "normal maps" to see a fully bumped instrument panel, moving canopy, fully modeled cockpit, and fully animated steering gear. Powered by O.S. 120 ax turning a 14x10 prop. Very good low end torque for high alpha flight and torque rolling. Agile in high rates fun to fly. Canopy is on 6 (knob). This is a 1/4 scale model. This is my first real color scheme utilizing all three map types. Look close at the highlights to see the metal fiber look.
This model has 3 4096x4096 tga files associated. If you experience problems loading this model follow these instructions.
1. Pick a Photofield
2. Import the rfx
3. Restart the Sim
4. Load the model
If problems persist PM me for a zip file with .dds files




Enjoy

name: Mike Oser's Dagger_EA
description:
This is Mike Oser's Dagger built as a group project and requested by Andy29847. This is a prototype RL model designed and built by Mike Oser right down to custom airfoils.






Enjoy

credits.oSLA25EngineBy: Junkboy999 modified by dhk79 and tweaked more by boof69

name: AT-802(FireBoss)_EA
description:
The Air Tractor AT-802AF (Fire Boss)

Controls:
Water release_ on channel 5 (dual rates)
Cockpit doors_ on channel 8 down or away position
Windshield wiper_on channel 8 up or close position
Retracts_on channel 7 (Smoke/Retract)
Flaps_on channel 6 (knob)

Features:
Moving Control suface armatures under wings
Moving Rudder pedals and linkage
Moving Throttle and Joystick
Headlights
Wingtip flood lights
Nav lights
Strobe light
Glowing exhaust pipes

The physics for this model were scrutinized by a real world pilot of this aircraft (Jim Anderson) and approved as realistic for scale flight.
For a water take-off a little pressure on the elevator is required also ample room.

If your interested in creating a CS for this model follow this for a master CS template and raw normals .psd

History:
The Air Tractor AT-802AF meaning it's the AT-802 model (A) for single seat cockpit and (F) meaning fire gate equipped. The AT-802 line are the worlds largst single engine aircraft. Mainly used in the agricultural industry but also used in fire fighting. Powered by a pratt and whittney PT6A-65AG turbine engine (the only non military aircraft allowed to use) turning a constant speed 5 blade reversable pitch prop. Cruising speed is 191 mph (307 kph) but the working speed is 130-160 mph or 209-257 kph.




Enjoy

name: Kaos_EA
description:
The KAOS. Made by request for Norton.
The Kaos is a 1970's pattern plane. The kits were designed by Joe Bridi.
That's all the information I could find.



Just over 6 pounds of airplane powered by a custom "Kaos .61" engine. Designed from real world torque curves for a .61 engine. Spinning a 12x10 Graupner Pylon Racer prop. Plenty of power without being ridiculous.

Special thanks to Junkboy999 for his OS .25 LA engine model, and to Dhk79 for his mods and additions to the same.

Sincere apologies to Jeffpn for stepping on his toes with this model. It was a misunderstanding on my part and totally my fault.




Enjoy

name: Krill Spark Evo I_EA
description:
This is the Krill models Spark Evo I Designed by Ivo Kryl in response to the collective input of all the F3A pilots and with special input from Andrew Jeskey.


This a great pattern flyer with plenty of power and balance. Knife edge fight is very easy and it knife edge loops in perfect track. The Spark Evo also slows nicely on the downline giving plenty of time for manouvers. Landing is very light and controlable with very low power.

Features a fully modeled RC interior. The canopy and chin hatches come off in a crash or can be released independantly by the "3 pos" switch.





Enjoy

name: SpaceWalker50%_EA
description:
SpaceWalker Single seat 50%
The SpaceWalker is a nice low wing gentle flyer. First flew in 1986 and designed by Jessi Anglin as a throw back to the golden age of aviation.
This particular SpaceWalker takes all design ques from Mr. Jim Dietrick's build of a semi-scale single seat 50% SpaceWalker.
From the dummy 4 cylinder engine and PVC exhaust to the cockpit pad and istrument panel. This model has a 13ft wing span and 71/2ft nose to tail.

This plane is as close to the actual models flight physics as possible. At 54lbs this plane still flys quite nimbly. Yet will squat on those hard landings as you would expect a heavy model to do.


Thanks to Abaser the landing gear are fully articulated. Meaning both the shocks and gear flex and move with contact with the ground.
Also the cockpit has a working ball level and a semi working compass on the dash. I couldn't get it to hold a particular direction.





Enjoy

name: Bristol M1_EA
description:
This is the Bristol M1c. The third revision of the Bristol M1 designed in 1916 by Frank Barnwell and built by the Bristol Aeroplan Corporation. Despite the higher speed and better manuverability It was rejected for it's high landing speeds that prevented it from landing in the small French airfields and the belief at the time that monoplanes were inherently unstable. Despite the percieved drawbacks the British Air Ministry ordered 125 of the Bristiol M1c. Changes from the M1A and M1B were the LeRone 9 cylinder rotary engine and a centrally mounted Vickers .303 machine gun.



Features:
Fixed scope camera------------------------------------F4
Fixed wing port cameras-------------------------------F6 and F7
Vickers machine gun------------------------------------Dual rates swithch
Detachable cowl to view the 9 cylinder LeRone----3 pos switch down position

Thanks to those who test flew and gave input.





Enjoy

name: McDonnell XP-67_EA
description:
The McDonnell XP-67 (1940's Experimental Aircraft)
Please note: This model was built for Real Flight 6 and may not fly as intended for earlier versions.

The XP-67 was a somewhat revolutionary design by McDonnell Aircraft. It used two turbo-charged engines whose exhaust was ejected at the rear of the engine nacelle, providing some additional thrust. The pilot was to sit in a pressurized cabin, and the plane's armament was very heavy for a fighter (six 37mm cannon in one prototype, and a 75mm cannon in another prototype). When viewed from above the aircraft had an unusual profile, in that the engine nacelles and fuselage were shaped to provide true aerofoil sections throughout. The first flight was made in January 1944, with testing undertaken later that year. Performance proved to be far from satisfactory, and modifications were made to improve certain stability problems. Before official trials could resume, however, the prototype was extensively damaged by fire and the program was abandoned.


This is my first model specificaly made for Real Flight 6. No tangable data could be found for the real life flight characteristics. Therefore the physics for this model are based soley on an educated guess on my part. I find this one
fun to fly to to the reletivly high landing speed. This model requires power on landing! Once landed push up on the
elevator for brakes.





Enjoy

name: Stamp SV-4b_EA
description:
The STAMPE et VERTONGEN SV.4b
Please note: This model was built for Real Flight 6 and may not fly as intended for earlier versions.

There is a small mistake which is easily fixed. The rudder tip pivot is set 20 and -220 by accident. 20 in both directions was the intended setting. This is a simple end user fix rather than reposting.

The Stampe SV was designed in 1933 by Belgian WW I pilots Jean Stampe and Maurice Vertongen. They were Moth dealers in the 1920´s. The SV aircraft was meant as a rival to the De Havilland D.H. 60 Moth and the D.H.82 Tiger Moth. In 1930 they build their own plant in Deurne (Antwerp Belgium) and the production started in 1933. The Belgian Air Force would replace their Tiger Moths and ordered 66 SV-4B planes. Only 65 were delivered.
In France and Algeria approx 850 Stampe SV 4A and SV 4C were built mostly powered by a 140 h.p. Renault 4 Pei engine.At this moment the SV-4B is one of the rarest airplanes in the world.


This model features:
Moving pilot and passenger doors............................(Channel 6 [knob])
Moving flight sticks and rudder pedals fore and aft
A working .303 Lewis gun....................................(Channel 6 [3pos])
The Lewis gun can be removed by the "Engine to Show" feature found in the editor under the engine component.
Just change engine to show to "None".






Enjoy

name: Stamp SV-4b_Monoplane_EA
description: This is a monoplane version of the Stampe et Vertongen SV.4b, made by special request for Nick.

name: CorsairF4U-1_EA
description:
This is the Chance Vought F4U1 Corsair. The F4U1 was the first production model of the Corsair line of fighters. It's simple cowl and "BirdCage" style canopy are distinctive details of this version.

I know that there are allot of Corsairs available, but this is my all time favorite airplane. I built this model for me but I want to share it also.


Special Thanks to dhk79, willsonman, and U-bird for their input and advise concerning the flight physics

This model features:
Folding wings and retractable canopy..........................Channel 8(3 pos)
Moving cowl flaps.........................................................Channel 8 (3pos)
Fully functioning retracts...............................................Channel 7 (Smoke/retracts)
6 Wing mounted machine guns.....................................Channel 5 (Dual rates)
3 piece flaps..................................................................Channel 6 (knob)
Functioning aileron balance tabs
Animated rudder pedals and stick
Full detail cockpit






Enjoy

name: The New Ryan G5_EA
description:
This is the Ryan STA.
The Ryan STs were a series of two seat, low-wing monoplane aircraft built by the Ryan Aeronautical Company. They were used as sport aircraft, as well as trainers by flying schools and the military of several countries.

Even though RealFlight has a Ryan STA and it's fun to fly, some visual as well as physical aspects were not addressed. The original version lacks guy wires and flaps and has some other minor missing details.


This model features:
A fully modeled and textured 30s era pilot.
Flaps...............................................Channel 8 (3pos)
Smoke.............................................Channel 7 (Smoke/retracts)
Functioning elevator trim tabs........Channel 6 (knob)







Enjoy

name: Macchi C 202 Folgore_EA
description:
This is the Macchi C.202 Folgore (Lightning). Virtually unknown outside Italy, the C.202 Folgore was the best fighter airplane fielded in significant numbers by the Regia Aeronautica (Italian Royal Air Force or RA) during World War II. This airplane demonstrated that Italy could design and build fighter aircraft to world-class standards. Aeronautica Macchi S. p. A. designed and built the Folgore (Lightning), which was based on an earlier Macchi design powered by a radial engine, the C.200 Saeta (Thunderbolt). To create the Folgore, Macchi's chief of design, Mario Castoldi, adapted the Saeta airframe to the German Daimler-Benz DB 601 liquid-cooled engine. Italy was a significant air-faring nation during the mid-1930s but its aviation industry began to lag late in the decade, particularly in engine development. No indigenous, in-line powerplant of sufficient power was available when the war started so early in 1940 Macchi had to import the German engine as a private venture. The results were impressive. Flat out, the Folgore was almost 97 kph (60 mph) faster than the Saeta's speed of 502 kph (312 mph).

Built by request for U-bird


This model features:
Fully textured and animated cockpit
Canopy................................Channel 8(3pos)
Machine Guns......................Channel 8(3pos)





Enjoy

name: AJ Spark Evo II_EA
description:
Completely updated physics for RealFlight 6 and up. Weights are now more realistic and it's clad in an Andrew Jesky color scheme.

This is the Krill models Spark Evo I Designed by Ivo Kryl in response to the collective input of all the F3A pilots and with special input from Andrew Jeskey.


This a great pattern flyer with plenty of power and balance. Knife edge fight is very easy and it knife edge loops in perfect track. The Spark Evo also slows nicely on the downline giving plenty of time for manouvers. Landing is very light and controlable with very low power.

Features a fully modeled RC interior. The canopy and chin hatches come off in a crash or can be released independantly by the 3 pos switch.





Enjoy

name: B-69 Vamp_EA
description:
Completely updated physics for RealFlight 6 and up. The vertical stabilizers are now inverted. Increased rudder authority and protects the prop during take offs and landings

This is self designed model with no particular influence. Solid flyer with good balance.



Features Retracts





Enjoy

name: Bristol M1_RF6_EA
description:
This is the Bristol M1c. The third revision of the Bristol M1 designed in 1916 by Frank Barnwell and built by the Bristol Aeroplane Corporation. Despite the higher speed and better maneuverability It was rejected for it's high landing speeds that prevented it from landing in the small French airfields and the belief at the time that monoplanes were inherently unstable. Despite the perceived drawbacks the British Air Ministry ordered 125 of the Bristol M1c. Changes from the M1A and M1B were the LeRone 9 cylinder rotary engine and a centrally mounted Vickers .303 machine gun.



Features:
Fixed scope camera------------------------------------F4
Fixed wing port cameras-------------------------------F6 and F7
Vickers machine gun------------------------------------Dual rates swithch

name: FK14 Le Mans_EA
description:
This is the FK14 Le Mans. Designed and manufactured by FK-Light Planes from Poland. It is a very unique personal cruiser. A one piece hood opens for full access to the cabin. Side by side seating and controls contained in a sports car like interior, and a modern instrument panel make a very stylish aircraft.


This model Features:
Delux interior with leather appointments
Many realistic lights exterior and interior (only visible at night sites)
Switchable canopies via the engine to show option found in the advanced editor under the engine component
Opening canopy..............................................Channel 8 (3pos)
Unique arched movement Flaps............................Channel 6 (knob)

For more detailed instructions on changing canopy styles view the designer notes in the edit window in the sim




Enjoy

name: Northrop YF-23 PAV-1(Black Widow)_EA
description:
Updated physics for RealFlight 6 and up.

This is the Northrop YF-23 PAV-1. This sleak and stealthy Advanced Tactical Fighter lost out to the Lockheed YF-22 in the UASF's ATF competition. Although this aircraft was faster and stealthier than it's competition it was less agile.
Two versions were created. The "Grey Ghost" and this the "Black Widow II".


Canopy............................Channel 5 (Dual rates)
Flaperons..........................Channel 6 (Knob)
Airbrakes and Krueger Flaps....10% throttle and below plus full flaps
Misslebay doors and missles.....Closed Channel 8 (3 pos) full away, Open (3 pos) mid position, missle release (3pos) full towards
Retracts............................Channel 7 (Smoke/retracts)





Enjoy

name: the CHESTER GOON_EA
description:
Updated physics for RealFlight 6 and up. Power, throws, and balance adjusted.

The Chester Goon

Art Chester followed on his successful air racer the "Jeep"" with the Goon. "Goon", like "Jeep" was named after characters in Popeye cartoons.
The Goon was built with a conventional welded steel tube frame and fabric covering. The wings used spruce spars and plywood covering. The mid-wing taildragger aircraft featured short-legged retractable landing gear. The engine was prepared to turn clockwise in anticipation of mounting a custom French propeller, but the propeller was also customized for American engines, and the engine needed to be modified again to rotate normally.


Features retracts......................Channel 7 (Smoke/Retracts)





Enjoy

name: GreatPlanes Phazer_EA
description:
Great Planes Phazer
This is a bungee and hand launch 90+ mph EDF Delta wing jet. Powered by an Ammo GPMG5185 brushless in-runner housed in a HyperFlow EDF unit, 35A ESC, and a 4s2200mAh lipo. This is a 3 channel model and is rudderless.

The Phazer for RealFlight runs as close to the real thing as possible. It is very fast and crisp on the controls.

Special Thanks to Madratter for his suggestions with concern to the prop to get the speed and flight times within normal range.

Features:
Animated pushrods





Enjoy

name: A-10 Thunderbolt II Warthog_EA
description:
The Fairchild Republic A-10 Thunderbolt II (Warthog) is an American single-seat, twin-engine, straight-wing jet aircraft developed by Fairchild-Republic in the early 1970s. The A-10 was designed for a United States Air Force (USAF) requirement to provide close air support (CAS) for ground forces by attacking tanks and other armored vehicles, and other ground targets with a limited air defense capability. It was the first USAF aircraft designed solely for CAS.


Special Thanks to csgill75 for his TF34-GE-400A sound profile for the engines.

Gun spin controlled by middle position of the 3 pos switch (Channel 8)
Gun firing is controlled by the far position of the 3 pos switch (Channel 5)
Split ailerons (Deceleron) are controlled by the rates switch (Channel 5)
Retracts are controlled by the retract/Smoke switch (Channel 7)
All of the load out is represented in the physics model using detachable pods.
None of which are setup to be released but most of the work is done for any one that wishes to make them dropable.





Enjoy

name: RangeVideoJet_EA
description:
Range Video Jet is an FPV platform from Range Video
The real world model can be built in many configurations
By adding middle wing sections the wingspan can be changed.
Even 2 fuselage configs are possible.
This simulator model is the long configuration and has an
FPV camera view


Camera Gimbal Horizontal is controlled by right slider
Camera Gimbal Vertical is controlled by left slider


Enjoy

name: Logo800Blackmatte_CS
description: This is a matte black CS based on one I seen in a 3D Masters video.

name: Logo800RedandWhite_CS
description: Red and white color scheme because it's my favorite color combo.

name: RedandYellow_CS
description: Red and yellow neon.

name: SAB Goblin 700_EA
description:
This is the SAB Goblin 700. High price, high gloss, and high performance. This neon monster is a real performer.

Dedicated to the memory of td9cowboy. A good friend to the forum and it's members he will be sorely missed.




Special thanks to mwilson914 for his comments on the physics.
This is my first Helicopter for Real Flight but I doubt it will be my last.





Enjoy

name: Outrage Velocity 90N2 FBL_EA
description:
Outrage Velocity 90 N2 FBL

This is the second vision of the Velocity 90 N not yet released for sale. This model was made with the cooperation of Outrage and includes all of the changes between this model and it's predecessor. If you are familiar with the Velocity 90 N you will notice most of the changes aft of the main shaft. New CNC aluminium forward and rear tail rotor gear boxes. The main gear has been upgraded and the horizontal fin is omitted. Among other changes.


Features many animated push rods and a fully modeled YS-91 engine.
Canopy release.......................Channel 6 (Knob)





Enjoy

name: Mikado Logo 800 Xxtreme_EA
description:
MIKADO LOGO 800 XXTREME FBL
From Mikado Model Helicopters this is the Logo 800 Xxtreme. This is a graceful 800 size electric Flybarless heli in real life and in the sim.
This model is purpose built for RealFlight 6 and up. Upgrade to enjoy


Special thanks to Kyle Stacey for his input for the final physics setup.
Special thanks to Jeffrey Johnson for providing super high quality pictures of his 800 Xxtreme.
Special Thanks to Kyle Dahl for quality pictures of his 800 Xxtreme.

Features custom Edge 813mm main blades and 115mm tail blades equipped for night flying.
The model itself is also night flying equipped.
Animated motor helps complete the illusion





Enjoy

name: Heli MAX 1SQ QuadCopter_EA
description:
This model requires the latest beta update 6.50.016 The orange and black blades needed for this model come with the new update.
The new model found in the latest beta is also a 1SQ. It is purely coincidental.


Heli-Max 1SQ quadcopter.
This is a micro quad with the stability of a much larger quadcopter. The TAGs™ (Triple Axis Gyro Stabilaization) is behind the solid stability of this fun little quad. Low weight (1.2oz AUW) and quality construction make for a very durable model.

I own this model personally and this RF model flys just like the real thing.
Low rates will give the real life flight behavior, but you can flip the dual rates switch to allow for flips and higher speed.


Features:
Canopy release on channel6(knob)
High rates for more extreme maneuvers.

Enjoy!





Enjoy

name: Compass Warp360_EA
description:
Compass Models Warp 360
The Compass Warp 360 is the newest helicopter to the Compass Model product line. The Warp 360 is a low-maintenance, aggressive, powerful and quiet 450 size electric helicopter!
The Compass Warp 360 utilizes a single-stage direct belt drive which allows for an extremely quiet and efficient drive-train. The rotor head is comprised of a nearly rigid design by Compass Model. This head design provides a level of precision and aggressive response more commonly associated with the larger 90 size electrics, to the 450 size market.


Thanks to the designer of the Compass Models Warp 360 Sebastian Zajonz
Special thanks to Sebastia Serra for his help in tuning the physics.






Enjoy
